intro: Platystemon penicillatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rock-rose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its small, needle-like leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated by insects, contributing to local biodiversity. Platystemon penicillatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in arid environments.
